website_summaries.verdict: The Blurr is a stiffer and lighter alternative a few of the carbon fiber options out there, with a nice quality construction.
pros: These extremely lightweight graphite carbon composite poles have a stiff design that makes navigating moguls and other challenging obstacles easier
Customers love the adjustable straps and comfortable TPU grips
Available in a variety of colors
cons: The tips are prone to breaking

customer_reviews.title: Careful with such a shiny finish, underneath paint they are black... beware of chips
customer_reviews.text: These look like great poles but the chrome finish on them had multiple chips on both poles from shipping I assume. My concern is that when your skis hit the bottom of the shaft, I would almost guarantee you knock off the shiny paint and see dull black underneath. After a season I think the finish will look bad. I returned to sender and purchased the Lollipop Ziplines. Those came today and my first impression is that they will look better longer because they are designed black at the bottom, so scratches will be less noticeable..
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love these things
customer_reviews.text: I have used a few pair of Zipline poles over the years, I generally have to buy another pair because my kids or my friends end up taking them. I guess you could say I am a bit of gear junkie, when I saw this color I had to have them. These things are durable but the technical aspect of these poles are far better than any aluminum pole I have used in the past. Yes they may cost a little more but they will also perform better. The thing I like the most is the swing weight is the perfect balance for me.
customer_reviews.author: Dara Hein

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I wanted carbon fiber, mostly because that materal would not feel so cold, unlike metal. I guess there is carbon fiber somewhere, but I can't really tell. They are nice poles, probably overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: Bikermaniac

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality overall. Have used them 6 or 10 times. Not sure the Velcro hand straps are necessary, they seem a little cumbersome. The biggest problem is the grip size. I do not have unusually large hands and the grips seem a little small with my gloves. Their customer service is very good and responsive. I would recommend this product with the caveat above.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but still quite strong.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace our older aluminum poles. While weight isn't really an issue for poles, these are nice and light. They don't seem to scratch or chip and are a little more flexible than the original poles were. I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Divecon

customer_reviews.title: Great looking poles!
customer_reviews.text: Look great, feel solid and feel very well constructed. Came well packaged and as advertised. Cant wait to try them out next week and will provide more details after I’ve had a chance to put them to the test, down Big Sky next week.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: stylish and light pole
customer_reviews.text: very nice colors, have the metallic blue, comes with power guards as well. very light and stiff pole, the only issue i have is that the graphics feels very easily
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Great Ski Pole - Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I had my last poles bend and the basket broke. Had a ski trip coming up so I ordered these. Came quickly and in time for my trip. Very happy the size, feel and color (orange) of these poles. Was a bit unsure when I ordered, but I am now very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Spin Doctor

customer_reviews.title: The metallic blue paint chips
customer_reviews.text: I've used these poles 3 times and the surface paint is chipping. I expected them to hold their beautiful looks a bit longer than this. I am also not sure the velcro will hold up over time so I may end up just stitching it closed. The way the straps close makes it much smaller than what I am used to, so I have to grip these differently than my last poles I had for 18 years. All minor annoyances, they work like they should otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra B. Kerman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality ski poles
customer_reviews.text: I bought these poles for GS and Slalom racing in the Master's category (I'm 47). They are good solid poles with an excellent swing weight; I particularly like the velcro closures on the straps which make it much easier to put the straps on while wearing gloves. The only reason I gave these 4 stars is that one pole broke, seemingly for no reason, the first day I used them. However, Amazon sent me a new pair within 2 days at no charge, and I have had no problems with them, so my guess is that the first set of poles was probably damaged in shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Zipline thin ski poles are the best.
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing & finding a thin ski pole thru zipline, I sent back the 1st pair I ordered. The new ones are just what my girlfriend wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Brad C.

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy w/expense of buying & shipping alternative basket
customer_reviews.text: Poles are ok, but was turned off when I saw expense (cost & shipping) of getting smaller basket. How much trouble would it be to include 2 baskets like in cheaper/lollipop model.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Quality Poles
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the chance to use them yet however they are light wait and balanced at a very good price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eberhard

customer_reviews.title: Bright mid-weight ski poles
customer_reviews.text: Much heavier than buddy's carbon poles. Bright orange. Maybe too bright. My jackets, skis, boot highlights, and now poles... working on 50 shades of orange. Lighter than my 30 year old aluminum poles.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: BOUGHT FOR CHRISTMAS
customer_reviews.text: WE WILL KNOW AFTER THE SNOW FLIES AND THEY GET SOME USE LOOKING FORWARD TO HEARING THAT THEY WORK REAL WELL
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty.
customer_reviews.text: They are nice and light. Only thing is I noticed the silver/chrome coating has chipped off in a couple of spots after a few days. I guess they'll be black from the points halfway up after another week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: The poles were just what I wanted and arrived early and in perfect shape.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Smith

customer_reviews.title: The pole came with ugly scratch
customer_reviews.text: the pole it self are the good stuff and they fill good/ But the came to my door with nasty scratch on them.
customer_reviews.author: Commnder1

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. Good light weight poles. Well balanced
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice poles
customer_reviews.text: 2 days of skiing with immediately after they arrived. Work great!
customer_reviews.author: Chi-Town Fan in CA.

customer_reviews.title: Great poles.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a friend, and the won't be used until this weekend, but their appearance and quality is very nice. I am using carbon pole that I paid a lot more and these feel equally as nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris N.

customer_reviews.title: Good Ski Poles - Very Light Weight
customer_reviews.text: Light weight - but strong. Assembly time is under 5 minutes. Adjustable wrist straps. All-in-all, they're pretty good!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffery Loman

customer_reviews.title: "Always reviewing method of packaging"
customer_reviews.text: Discovered that powder baskets were not attached/installed; they were packaged near the grips; my fault for not checking--Other poles I have ordered arrived boxed with baskets installed. This was simply a different method of shipping. Assuming the baskets install securely, I am confident I will be pleased with poles.
customer_reviews.author: peter irwin

customer_reviews.title: Good pole
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the pole except the carbon finish scratches easily revealing a chrome underlayment. I would suggest purchasing the chrome version
customer_reviews.author: Jim Stone

customer_reviews.title: I really like the poles but they seem to chip to easily.
customer_reviews.text: The ski poles are great but the Finnish has already chipped after one day on the slopes.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: These poles are excellent. I love the larger basket at the end especially in powder! They very sharp but are packed with a tube over the tip! The paint scheme is very professional and sharp! They are also very light and stiff!
customer_reviews.author: Collin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grips.
customer_reviews.text: Light, strong, and that bright color stands out. Excellent grips.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Falkner

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with purchase. Used them for the last 3 days and have zero regrets. Very light, well made poles.
customer_reviews.author: FlyLow

customer_reviews.title: Great poles, but poorly designed straps
customer_reviews.text: Great poles with the exception of the straps. Every other run I had to re-adjust the straps. Needs additional Velcro or better yet, a loop type of adjuster that stays put. The fix that seems to work is to zip-tie the strap in place.
customer_reviews.author: Gary U

customer_reviews.title: Strong,light, aerodynamic
customer_reviews.text: Like the poles. The straps are a bit small for the hand with the glove.
customer_reviews.author: john griffin

customer_reviews.title: Best Ski Poles I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: These poles are not only have the best grip and swing weight but they are also the most durable. I am a world cup level halfpipe skier and I normally break up to 2-3 pairs a season. I have not to this day broken one pair of these poles.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Schuiling

customer_reviews.title: Great poles and free shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the poles came with powder baskets and small baskets. They came with powder baskets (big!). Not so good for N.H. no worries, I ordered the smaller baskets for 3.99 and they came right away- free shipping! Love my new poles!
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Nekoroski

customer_reviews.title: Great ski pole
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pole. Light, great looking. Love the easy adjustable strap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great grip
customer_reviews.text: Great grip. My 10yr old son loves how light they are!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Nice poles
customer_reviews.text: I like these very much. My only complaint is they came with powder baskets only. I prefer the regular style baskets. Nice and light.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Ski Poles
customer_reviews.text: The poles are light weight, well constructed, and finished neatly.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Esposti

customer_reviews.title: I love these poles
customer_reviews.text: I love these poles! Super comfy grips and straps, great swing weight, they look and fell great. I love the bright colors and powder baskets.
customer_reviews.author: aimee doran

customer_reviews.title: Bent and broke
customer_reviews.text: One pole arrived bent and broke before I could even use them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight heavy duty ski pole
customer_reviews.text: Awesome ski pole works great out in the snow of Colorado
customer_reviews.author: Huckelberry20

customer_reviews.title: Great look and feel
customer_reviews.text: Great look and feel. Haven’t had a chance to take them on the slopes yet but if they perform like the quality they are I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hassfurther

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and comfortable grip. The new powder baskets are helpful for ...
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and comfortable grip. The new powder baskets are helpful for skiing the whole mountain. Tested them out on opening day at Targhee and loved them.
customer_reviews.author: andre schwartz

customer_reviews.title: High quality ski poles
customer_reviews.text: I like the firmness of these ski poles. I also like that they have two interchangeable types of baskets. The Velcro straps are easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Long time skier

customer_reviews.title: A happy grandson!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that you defined your product from others by telling us it is an Olympics choice. Made it easier to choose. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rona Gandy

customer_reviews.title: Broke on third day!
customer_reviews.text: Third day using and pole snapped. Got caught under ski and tip snapped off.
customer_reviews.author: AMJ

customer_reviews.title: Terrific set of ski poles
customer_reviews.text: Terrific set of ski poles. Good flex and large bails make for superior down hill pole touches on the steeps.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and very sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: These poles are great. Excellent quality!! Would recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Nicholas

product_meta.title: Ski Poles Graphite Carbon Composite - Zipline Blurr 16.0 - U.S. Ski Team Official Supplier
feature_bullets: GRAPHITE CARBON COMPOSITE TECHNOLOGY - High modulus carbon fiber graphite replaces the outdated aluminum of most ski poles, resulting in a pole that reduces vibration with every pole pant and is extremely lightweight and durable.

STIFF 16.0mm TAPERED SKI POLE - Pole shaft tapers from 16.0mm at the handle to 14.0mm at the tip for a stiffer pole with a lighter swing-weight that is used by World Cup and Olympic Gold Medal athletes like David Wise. New for 2020-21 Season: Blurr XT longer Grip Option and Limited Edition Blurr Honeycomb with reinforced Kevlar lower section for increased strength.
LARGE, POWDER BASKET: Popular with free skiers and powder skiers because Blurr poles feature a 9mm larger powder basket to tackle the fresh powder all skiers dream about.

“ZIP TOUCH” DUAL DENSITY GRIP - Our signature “trigger finger” ZipGrip is built with thermoplastic (TPU) and contours to your hand, preventing your gloves from slipping. Velcro Straps are easily adjustable on the fly
Choice of Olympic Gold Medalist, David Wise.
